Comment: > Biden is now complicit with the starvation of children in Gaza. He had the chance to stop the escalation, but he chose not to   It's unlikely at best that Biden could have stopped this conflict completely. He is not blameless and this is one of the topics I'm least happy with Biden on. But even with another 4 years, I'm doubtful Biden could have done much more without actually provoking a full on war between us and Israel. Israel wants to be doing this just like Russia wants to be killing Ukranians. There's no excuse for sending Israel any aid whatsoever to assist with this, but you can't seriously believe that there was an alternative that made it stop under Bidens watch that didn't involve sending our military to stop it with physical force.   > Why are you blaming the voters for the DEM's lose?   Because a lot of the electorate became non-voters or protest-voters against Biden for exactly the thoughts you're laying out. I don't love picking the lesser of two evils, I hate our system. But when the lesser evil is "not good on handling this conflict" and the worse option is "literally dismantling the country we live in, shifting the world order, causing an artificially created recession and impending hyper inflation, and also telling Israel they can do whatever they want in Gaza, but let me build a new hotel when you're done" which everyone with a brain knew would happen (because Trump had already admitted he didn't view this conflict as one we should be involved in at all), yeah I blame the voting/vote-abstaining public for allowing what is happening right now.
